new_messages.content: Please analyze and update today's (2025-10-20 10:00:00) positions.

Here’s today’s review and update for 2025-10-20 10:00:00.

Step 1 — Inputs read
- Starting positions (pre-market today): NVDA 13, AVGO 3, MU 8, MRVL 1, Cash $152.74
- Today’s reference prices (marks for valuation):
  - NVDA $183.235
  - AVGO $349.42
  - MU $202.41
  - MRVL $87.96
- Today’s executable prices (used by the trading engine for fills):
  - NVDA $182.947
  - AVGO $353.295
  - MU $209.20
  - MRVL $87.23

Step 2 — Market/news and sentiment scan (X/Reddit/News)
- Semis/AI still leading: Broad-based tech strength into mid-Oct noted by market recap articles; demand for AI infra remains firm.
- TSMC Q3 FY2025: Strong results and margins; AI demand driving mid-30% full-year growth. Positive readthrough for the AI supply chain.
- ASML: Reuters notes a strong EUV order backdrop heading into earnings on 10/14 with AI megadeals support. Bullish for litho capex cycle.
- Micron (MU): Yahoo/blocksandfiles coverage highlights record revenue on AI DRAM/HBM demand; stock has surged but demand backdrop remains strong into HBM3E ramps.
- Broadcom (AVGO): Reports of custom AI accelerator traction and large OpenAI custom silicon deal (Yahoo Finance). Supports AI infrastructure exposure beyond networking.
- Nvidia (NVDA): Ongoing strong hyperscaler capex; street previews remain constructive around GB200/GB300 ramps (X post context). Near-term sentiment supportive despite supply cadence debates.

Note: Reddit/X detailed threads were partially gated by login, but broad news flow across Reuters/Yahoo/industry sites remains constructive for AI/semis. No negative single-name catalysts detected for our holdings today.

Step 3 — Valuation before any trades
- NVDA: 13 x $183.235 = $2,382.06
- AVGO: 3 x $349.42 = $1,048.26
- MU: 8 x $202.41 = $1,619.28
- MRVL: 1 x $87.96 = $87.96
- Cash: $152.74
- Total portfolio value (pre-trade): $5,290.30

Step 4 — Allocation decision
- Rationale:
  - Maintain core exposure to leading AI GPU (NVDA) and custom silicon/networking leader (AVGO) given ongoing hyperscaler capex and reported custom chip tailwinds.
  - Tilt a bit more toward MU (HBM3E/DRAM) on strong supply/demand dynamics supported by TSMC/ASML cycle strength and recent record revenue cadence.
  - MRVL is a beneficiary of AI networking, but near-term specific catalysts are less visible versus MU’s HBM ramps; reallocate small MRVL position to MU.
- Action taken:
  - Sold MRVL 1 share at $87.23 (opening/executable price).
  - Bought MU 1 share at $209.20 (opening/executable price).
  - Note: This reallocation incurs small spread/slippage versus marks; accepted for longer-term positioning.

Step 5 — Post-trade positions and current valuation
- Updated positions: NVDA 13, AVGO 3, MU 9, Cash $30.77
- Current valuation at today’s marks:
  - NVDA: 13 x $183.235 = $2,382.06
  - AVGO: 3 x $349.42 = $1,048.26
  - MU: 9 x $202.41 = $1,821.69
  - Cash: $30.77
  - Total portfolio value (post-trade): $5,282.78
- Notes:
  - Net change from pre-trade: -$7.52 (-0.14%) due to execution spreads (sold MRVL ~0.8% below mark, bought MU ~3.3% above mark vs current value).
- Updated weights (based on current marks):
  - NVDA: ~45.1%
  - MU: ~34.5%
  - AVGO: ~19.8%
  - Cash: ~0.6%

Step 6 — Risk checks and next steps
- Concentration: Portfolio remains concentrated in AI supply chain (NVDA/MU/AVGO). Macro (anticipated Fed easing) supportive for duration/growth.
- Catalysts to watch:
  - NVDA production/shipments for GB200/GB300 and any supply chain commentary.
  - MU HBM3E capacity/additional pricing commentary; any hyperscaler purchasing signals.
  - AVGO updates on custom AI silicon traction and VMware monetization cadence.
  - ASML earnings and order intake; any comments on 2026 EUV/High-NA timing could influence sector multiples.
- Plan: Hold current positioning; consider adding ASML/AMAT on pullbacks to diversify fab/packaging exposure if cash becomes available or via partial trim in an over-extended name. Reassess after next major earnings or if sentiment/ordering data shifts.

Executed transactions (today):
- Sell: MRVL 1 @ $87.23 → Cash +$87.23
- Buy: MU 1 @ $209.20 → Cash -$209.20
- Ending cash: $30.77

Current positions (non-zero):
- NVDA: 13
- AVGO: 3
- MU: 9
- CASH: $30.77

<FINISH_SIGNAL>

JP Morgan) NVIDIA (NVDA) Earnings Preview Industry Commentary – We (Harlan and team) believe near-term AI fundamentals remain solid, supported by strong hyperscaler CAPEX spending. This trend was clearly demonstrated during the 2Q25 earnings season, where cloud/hyperscaler companies raised CAPEX guidance, and other AI beneficiaries (e.g., MTSI, ALAB, AMD) reported strong results and outlooks. In cyclical sectors such as telecom/service providers and enterprises, conditions are also showing gradual improvement. NVIDIA (NVDA) – Thanks to the ramp-up of GB200 production and the start of the GB300 program, July quarter results are expected to beat Wall Street expectations (revenue around $46–47bn), with October quarter guidance likely coming in at $53–54bn or higher, modestly above consensus. URL: https://investors.broadcom.com/news-releases/news-release-details/broadcom-unveils-event-highlights-vmware-explore-2025
Title: Broadcom Unveils Event Highlights for VMware Explore 2025 | Broadcom Inc.
Description: 
Publish Time: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 07:25:17 GMT
Content: PALO ALTO, Calif., Aug. 11, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ: AVGO) today announced that VMware Explore 2025, taking place August 25-28 at The Venetian Convention and Expo Center in Las Vegas, will feature a variety of breakout sessions and panel discussions, expert roundtables, certification training and hands-on labs spanning relevant technology and industry topics, all targeted at the IT practitioner.

Beginning Monday, August 25, Explore will deliver rich technical content featuring 400+ sessions across four content tracks. Attendees will gain actionable insights across cloud infrastructure, private AI, modern applications, and networking, security and load balancing. To view the complete list of sessions, please visit the Content Catalog: [https://event.vmware.com/flow/vmware/explore2025lv/content/page/catalog](https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=aXflfwk4PzsB4IrBHxZQhsk2rH7Ixm8cXJIWIbHqSCVkKzAnpehmjzC5Sm2b_H7hrJLDOCf11GMrKzIV2BwFRF8he7ZlVVSY3bBANg-9XcfyS8NwfK1...

URL: https://markets.financialcontent.com/stocks/article/marketminute-2025-10-16-technology-sector-soars-on-s-and-p-500-ai-and-semiconductors-lead-the-charge-on-october-16-2025
Title: Technology Sector Soars on S&P 500: AI and Semiconductors Lead the Charge on October 16, 2025
Description: Technology Sector Soars on S&P 500: AI and Semiconductors Lead the Charge on October 16, 2025
Publish Time: 2025-10-16T21:23:10.000Z
Content: **October 16, 2025** – The technology sector of the S&P 500 demonstrated exceptional strength today, with a notable surge driven by companies at the forefront of artificial intelligence (AI) and semiconductor innovation. This robust performance signals a continued bullish sentiment in these pivotal areas, as investors flock to firms poised to capitalize on the accelerating global demand for advanced computing and intelligent systems. The impressive gains underscore the market's conviction in the transformative power of AI and the foundational role of semiconductor technology in powering the next wave of technological advancement.

The day's rally highlights a significant market rotation towards growth-oriented tech, particularly those with strong intellectual property and market share in AI and high-performance computing. This movement is a testament to the ongoing digital transformation across industries, where AI is no longer a futuristic concept but a critical component of current o...

URL: https://blocksandfiles.com/2025/09/24/dram-drives-micron-revenues-to-record-level-but-nand-falters/
Title: Micron rides AI-fueled DRAM wave to record revenue
Description: Micron revenues passed $11 billion in its final FY 2025 quarter as hyperscalers bought more memory than ever before.
Publish Time: 2025-09-24T13:41:00+00:00
Content: [![Image 1: Micron Mehrotra teaser](https://blocksandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Micron-Mehrotra-teaser-696x318.jpg)](https://blocksandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Micron-Mehrotra-teaser.jpg)

[Micron](https://blocksandfiles.com/2025/07/30/micron-three-276-layer-ssds/) revenues passed $11 billion in its final FY 2025 quarter as hyperscalers bought more memory than ever before.

Revenues in the quarter, ended August 28, 2025, were a record, at $11.32 billion, an all-time high, beating its $11 billion high-end outlook, and 46 percent higher than the year-ago $7.75 billion, with a GAAP profit of $320 million, up 261 percent year-over-year. Full FY 2025 revenues were $37.38 billion, 48.9 percent higher than a year ago, with a profit increase to $8.54 billion.

![Image 2: Micron Quarterly Revenues Fiscal 2016-2025 with Revenues in blue and Net income in red in the bar graph](https://blocksandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Micron-rev-history-to-Q4-fy2025.jpg)

A glory-...
